website_summaries.verdict: Take a trip around the world with action heroes who help build students' map-reading skills and expand their global knowledge .
pros: Action hero characters guide students through maps and activities written to boost their world geography understanding
Includes some U.S. regional geography, too
cons: May be too simplistic for middle school students

customer_reviews.title: Too easy for 11 yr old
customer_reviews.text: Easier than I expected, I was looking to teach countries, cities, and capitols, but this is more like elementary school maps, not good for a middle schooler. I would say 7-10 years , begining map reading
customer_reviews.author: tonya

customer_reviews.title: Great for 7+
customer_reviews.text: We really enjoyed the first book in this series (Geography Maps & Activities Beginner), so I ordered this for my 8 year old. It's fantastic, introducing maps and map skills in a fun, colorful manner. The beginning of the book covers different types of maps and map symbols, then it begins to explore different regions of the world (not just continents, but also, for example, the Caribbean or India). There are fewer hands-on activities than the Beginner level book (no directions for building a rain stick), but still plenty of crosswords and map searches. I feel the agree range is too old for this book, I would mark it as 7+ as long as the child is a strong reader.
customer_reviews.author: LittleBug

customer_reviews.title: Engaging workbook
customer_reviews.text: I use it for my 4th and 5th grader. They both love it and keep asking for more geography lessons. At first it appears to be too easy but it quickly goes on to more complex concepts. Overall, it is a fun way to teach geography. Even though it doesn't go into too much detail, it provides a great overview and zero preparation time for me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonshopper

customer_reviews.title: very good for first timers or reviewers
customer_reviews.text: I loved this book. I bought it for my homeschooled teens but I found it to be a great review book for me. I am 75 and had forgotten a lot in this book.
customer_reviews.author: Sondra

customer_reviews.title: So many things for me to learn. ( and I’ve been to college)
customer_reviews.text: I’m 68 yrs old and there’s plenty for me to learn in this book!

customer_reviews.title: Awesome geography book
customer_reviews.text: We used this for my 1st and 3rd graders and they loved it. Colorful pages and interesting, fun lessons.

customer_reviews.title: We Like It
customer_reviews.text: Great for learning how to read maps, but we did find a few mistakes, for instance an unscramble that spelt out "physncnl features" on page 17. I use this to homeschool my 10 year old. She doesn't love Geography, but she doesn't mind working in this book.

customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my granddaughter but it was very challenging for her age. It was really colorful and had a good amount of information but it didn't keep her interested.

customer_reviews.title: A very educational book
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as part of my son's 5th grade homeschool curriculum and I'm pleasantly surprised by it. The lessons are clear, and informative and easy to understand.I would recommend this as a great starting point to spark interest in geography.

customer_reviews.title: A HIT WITH FACT LOVING KID AGE 7
customer_reviews.text: This was a big hit with a lively seven year old boy I know. He loves to spout facts and statistics, is fascinated by maps of all kinds, and is a pretty strong reader - can handle the text on his own. His mom thanks me repeatedly and says he consults the book several times a week. Really glad I got it for him.
